page.title: 10THE OLD SCHOOL CAPEL
page.content: The old village school was opened in 1911.With the closure of first Hougham and then Alkham schools a new school was constructed in Capel and opened in 1972. The Old School is now a residential centre for Kent schoolchildren.When we visited the centre there was a group of 25 Secondary school children in residence.One of the original classrooms has been divided into two dormitories,one for boys and one for girls.The headmistress's study is now a staff bedroom.A new kitchen and showers have been built.The 'modern' mobile classroom, built in 1967 ,is now a lecture and recreation room.The other original classroom is now a combined canteen and T.V. room. Groups usually spend 4 to 5 days at the centre,exploring and studying the local area.
